page.title: 02TRAFFIC AND TRANSPORT
page.content: The A429 runs along the West side of our area from Cirencester to Stow-in the Wold. It is a major road and a old one _ it is the Roman Fosse way going from Bath to Lincoln. The A433 is the other main road _ and again parts of it follow a Roman road _ Akeman street. It goes from Cirencester to Burfard and runs right through the middle of Barnsley village. It is a busy road with a speed limit of 40 mph through the village. During one hour in August we saw 95 cars heading towards Cirencester and 132 cars going towards Bibury and Burford. About 25 were obviously local villagers and there were several farm vehicles using the road. Only 3 caravans passed through and one car with a foreign number plate.
